35325864.review:
This, is a wonderful reminder on why kids, or people in general, should not take drugs, this seems like a game that was made utalizing PCP or LSD, and SOMEHOW someone at Popcap managed to create an addictive yet creepy game, I feel like im matching  white bloodcells that have been mostly dipped into paintbuckets, and they also have had googly eyes glued to them

A perfect video game while drunk, I (not exaggerating) have a feeling people would feel very weird while playing this game drunk


Every bit of joking aside tho, this game is actually a lot of fun and for its time, was a unique twsit on the puzzle genre, correct me if I'm wrong, but this game brought the whole "drag entire rows" into the puzzle genre, and other popcap games or puzzle games in general (Huniepop as another example) took note of this games particular attribute

The game itself might feel a bit outdated, but for someone who grew up on these games off his brother's computer and his sisters laptop, I can tell you, these game's are not the most deep in terms of story, nore are their gameplay elements groundbreaking, but what they are is simple, unadulturated fun, basic games that are fun time wasters, easy to pick up for only 5 bucks, and awesome throwbacks to the 90s and early 2000s without purchases being completely clouded by nostalgia and suprisingly holding up well


These games aren't groundbreaking or revolutional, but what they did do (and still manage to do) is provide fun, that can be played in binges, or short bursts, sometimes simple yet addicting gameplay is all you need for a fun game

33211529.review:
I played Chuzzle back when it was a 'Popcap Games' browser game. I killed so many hours on it that my keyboard may never forgive me. Finding out that it was on Steam was a delight; I was quick to put it on my wishlist, and more than happy to finally pick it up for myself.

Chuzzle is not what anyone could call a particularly complicated game. It's your basic sliding puzzle game, with cute and fuzzy blocks and a couple unusual tricks up the game's sleeve with its giant chuzz-balls, rainbows, and the annoying and froth-inducing locks. All in all, it's a perfect time-waster that can eat up hours before you ever realize how long you've been playing.

For its price, the game will give you hours upon hours of fun. Highly recommended for lovers of Bejeweled sorts of games for something similar enough to be familiar, but different enough to give you a slightly new challenge to things.

If you wait for a sale or sell some Steam cards on the market, it will cost you hardly anything, so it's a safe buy. Just make sure you put hardware acceleration on in the options menu so you can select a better resolution or stick it in window mode.

32759281.review:
Several years into the future, a biotics company engineers a mutant species with the intent of selling them as pets. However, in the company's greed and arrogance, they neglected the needs of these modified organisms. As a result, they live a life of unending agony and suffering. The government attempted to halt the lab's twisted experiment, but the CEO refused, even going as far as hiring an elite private forces to guard the company's assets.
Pushed to its limit, the national guard sieged the biotics company's headquarters as well as the lab in which the organisms were being grown. In it's rage, the government slaughtered everyone involved; scientists, businessmen, secretaries.
With the company no more, the government found itself in a rough spot; who would be left to take care of the tortured mutants? In an act of mercy, many volunteers have stepped forward to help mercifully put the tormented creatures to sleep.

Chuzzle's main story liberally shares similar themes from classics such as Frankenstein and Jurassic Park, in regards to the costs and risks of unfettered scientiffic progress. There's also a minor sub-plot involving one of the protagonist's struggles with accepting their newfound gender identity, but I am no expert on LGBTQ+ stuff so I'll leave analysis of that specific part of the story. What I can say is that the side-plot does help in tastefully preventing the game from coming across as some kind of unnuanced "Anti-Science" propaganda film.

Another major theme that comes up in the story is the moral dilemma that the general popuace faces when confronted with an irredeemable evil. The two logical extremes of this dilemma are embodied by two central characters; the senate at the beginning of the story, who turn a blind eye to the dilemma for fear of getting their hands dirty and losing the much-coveted "moral high-ground," and the National Guard who remorselessly murder the hundreds of people involved with the experiments.

Overall, Chuzzle's story is a beautifully-written tragedy that asks the audience to truely critically think about the themes presented, which is a daring feat considering how most modern videogames aren't willing to take that kind of risk on an actually meaningful level (Except maybe Mafia III or Deus Ex, but I haven't played those games yet give me time damnit). I easily give Chuzzle a
10/10. Would misinterperet a relaxing cartoony match 3 game about fluffy spheres with eyeballs again.

29135626.review:
Yea, it's a match 3 game, but you can't compare this to Bejewled. It's nothing like Bejewled. 
In Bejewled, you can only move one piece at a time, in Chuzzle, you move rows. 
Now I believe Chuzzle is harder than Bejewled leaving you staring at those colours for hours making you dizzy and my god do your eyes hurt, but it's a timeless classic and I simply love it.

Not to mention, combos are easier to do in Bejewled and so much harder in Chuzzle giving you a higher satisfaction when making combos in this game. Have I also mentioned this game was my childhood?

It's cute, hard, endless, content filled and I highly recommend this game.

28091957.review:
Если захотите включить аппаратное ускорение в игре, чтобы сменить разрешение, и наткнетесь на ошибку, которая приведет к блокировке управлению мышкой в ОС, то не спешите перезагружать компьютер.
Достаточно просто запустить диспетчер задач (CTRL+ALT+DEL), там отыскать запущенный процесс с ошибкой, выделить его стрелками на клавиатуре и нажать клавишу DEL. Процесс должен быть завершен и окно с ошибкой пропадет. Тогда заходите в игру и проверяйте разрешение.

Сама игра отличная, на Windows XP много времени в ней провел)
Если коротенько, то ваша задача - перемещать чуззлов (шарики), составив их вместе. Тогда они лопаются и появляютя новые. Задача усложняется тем, что эти шарики разных цветов, а надо собрать одного цвета, к тому же шарики могут блокироваться, тогда их сдвинуть нельзя (двигаешь один шарик по горизонтали или вертикали - двигается весь ряд вместе с этим шариком), шарики могут быть большого размера (тогда они привязываются к рамкам игрового поля и за них не уходят) или же, при большом комбо, появляется взрывающийся шарик, который, при своем взрыве, задевает соседние шарики. В самой игре есть 4 режима - это обычный, когда ты собираешь шарики, зарабатываешь за это очки и наполняешь флягу с опытом. При достижении определенного опыта повышается уровень игры и игра становится чуточку сложнее (кстати, в этом режиме дается несколько попыток на продолжение - ведь иногда бывает так, что больше нет ходов. Используя попытку, можно перемешать игровое поле и шарики появятся случайным образом). Есть режим, где все происходит на время - внизу появляется специальная шкала, которая сама постепенно заполняется. Если вы не успеете составить из шариков комбо, то блокируется один шарик, потом еще один. И так до тех пор, пока игра не закончится. Есть режим наоборот, где нет ограничений во времени и попытках, этакий дзен, свободная игра. Там набирается определенное количество очков и рядом с флягой появляется одна чуззля. Ну а последний режим - это режим составления мозайки. Чуззлы становятся, как правило, двух цветов и из них надо составить определенный рисунок, который задает игра. Там их четыре, можно выбирать любой в любое время.
Что касается самих чуззлов, то эти маленькие шерстяные шарики с глазами очень няшные, всегда смотрят по направлению курсора, при частом на них нажатии начинают чихать и громким чихом сбрасывают всю шерсть, которая чуть позже отрастает. Если тянуть весь ряд шариков быстро-быстро, то их начинает немного укачивать, но чуззлы быстро приходят в себя.
В общем, это весьма симпатичная и позитивная игра, которая вышла много раньше, чем появились нормальные мобильные игры и гораздо раньше, чем появился первый Айфон.

25583432.review:
毛毛球，是一款由Popcap发行的消除小游戏，该公司的作品广受玩家喜爱，比如祖玛、宝石迷阵以及植物大战僵尸等等。

本作的消除方式也很有创意：玩家可以拖动一整行或是一整列的毛球，如果3个或3个以上的同色毛球相遇，就会消掉。5个同色毛球相遇还会产生毛球炸弹，偶尔还会出现超大只毛球以及银锁，增加游戏难度。

游戏模式有4种：

经典模式下，有3次洗牌机会，无法继续消除会消耗洗牌机会，3次机会用完游戏结束。

时间模式下，玩家需要尽可能快的消除毛球以获得继续游戏的时间，如果消除速度慢，就会出现银锁惩罚。被锁住的毛球不能被移动，从而增加游戏难度，2次洗牌机会用完后游戏结束。

无尽模式下，玩家可以一直进行游戏以积累更高的分数。

谜题模式下，玩家需要移动毛球以得到给出的图案。

本作没有steam成就，但是有游戏内奖杯，对于玩家来说算是不小的挑战。经典模式和时间模式都有玩家排行榜，可供参考。毛球消除特效和音效都很可爱，闲暇时间玩上一小会是个不错的选择。

24187274.review:
This game is the best, back in 10 years ago it was the high-quality version of solitary or minesweeper among those time waster games. Colorful, easy to play, very funny and fluffy :) Ahh the memories.

+Visuals - famous fluffy boys :) Colorful, with simple shapes and nice effects, the game is very nice :) It still looks nice in 2016.
+Sound - very nice sound work, funny chuzzle voices, nice relaxing background music, nice effects.
+Gameplay - 4 mods/2 difficulties for normal modes: puzzle mode/stack 3/speed mode/infinite mode. It has all kind of mods that will entertain you if you want to relax or if you want some fast action :)
+Replayability - I can't get enough of it, hundreds of hours wasted when I was a school-kid, and still not bored.
+Built in achievements (no steam achievements :( )
-No steam cards

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=717730414

This game is a legend <3, I would highly recommend to buy it for those who missed that hit, those who played don't need my recommendation  ¯\_(ツ)_/¯,

19360416.review:
Chuzzle Deluxe - это казуальная игра от компании PopCap.

Вам даётся поле 6 на 6 клеток, в которых находятся разноцветные шарики. Вы должны сжигать шарики, двигая полосу из шариков по горизонтали и вертикали, чтобы они сгорали минимум по 3 штуки. За уничтожение 5 штук вы получаете специальный взрывной шарик. После некоторого времени на шариках появляются замки, которые блокируют полосу по горизонтали и вертикали, где находится шарик. Вы можете два раза перетасовать всё поле, если не останется доступных ходов, ещё получить такую возможность можно, получая каждые 150 тысяч очков.

В игре есть четыре режима:
Основной аркадный, где вы просто сжигаете шарики, продвигаясь по уровням, надеясь что ходы не кончатся.
Режим на время, в котором вы должны успеть сжигать шарики, иначе получите замок на одну из клеток.
Бесконечный режим, в котором нельзя проиграть, вы будете бесконечно сжигать шарики.
Режим головоломки.

В аркадном и режиме на время есть две сложности на выбор. В игре присутствуют внутриигровые достижения.
Могу порекомендовать игру любителям убить время. Я провёл в эту игру много времени, играя на телефоне.

16549998.review:
*Sigh*

I loved this game. It's a very nice-looking tile-matching puzzle game with beautiful animations and "characters" design, which in my opinion deserved only positive reviews by the standarts of time it was released. Chuzzle and MadCaps both were my most favourite time killers for many years. Long time ago I introduced it to my parents and they loved it too, played thousands of hours and still playing it.

[b]But unfortunately technical issues are ruining the experience.[/b] There is an annoying problem: game crashes as soon as you try to switch it to windowed mode. And I don't think PopCap games cares about this game anymore - you cant even find mention of it on a their website. Version of the game you're gonna get on Steam is 1.0, however, 1.01 could be easily find on the different sources and it doesn't have same problem. Demo version from developer's website even marked as 2.0. But for unknown reasons, modern version of the game is not on Steam. So unless you have 4:3 monitor as your primary monitor - you're going to look at the stretched image. Pretty disappointing. 

But game itself is very good and if not technical issues I would definitely recommend considering it, if you're looking for something from this genre.

Rip.

[b]UPD:[/b] Changed recommendation from negative to positive. Game can be switched to windowed mode if you disable H/W Acceleration. After that you can turn it back on, so you can select resolution larger, than 640x480.

16458403.review: This game brought me back to the classic popcap games, a great nostalgia trip.

15525420.review:
This cute and easy "break'em" game is the perfect time killer. Match 3 or more of a kind and amass points that will carry you on into the next level. Depending on the mode, you might face locked Chuzzles that you can't move or huge Chuzzles that make it difficult to move certain lines. You know you've matched when there's a flurry of Chuzzle hair (though it looks like cat hair) flying from that part of the screen. 

It also has some cute "easter" eggs that are fun to do every once in awhile. I like making my Chuzzles Dizzy and tickling them til they're near puking. The death glare they give you if you hang your cursor on them too long is kind've adorable too. Give them a shot when you have a chance. :)

15282037.review:
Adorable exploding fuzzballs, squeaking as they poof away by slide-matching them.

This is not as elaborate an offering as Bejeweled 3, but it's pretty close. It's certainly as well-made, offering that perfect combination of visuals, music and sound effects, but where Bejeweled goes for fancy, clinkity gems, Chuzzle goes for the cute factor and delivers in spades.

The gameplay is a bit different too. Here you slide entire rows or columns back and forth or up and down, to form clumps of three of more. With that, you have classic, timed mode, zen, and puzzle.

I like the little touches. If you grab a row or column and shake it violently this way and that, the chuzzles get disoriented and dizzy. Or if you click on any chuzzle, they emit a note. The note is higher from top-left to bottom-right, letting you basically play a tune by clicking on different chuzzles. This is entirely unnecessary, just a nice little touch. Or if you hover your mouse on a chuzzle and leave it there, after a while they frown and shake it off, moving the mouse cursor away. Adorable game, fun to play.

14818318.review: Excellent puzzle game for some time killing.

14709899.review:
I love this game ! Chuzzle are the cutest things in the world !
The different modes in the deluxe game are very funny =)

13620834.review: Good game from ages ago. Compared to today's games the graphics and sounds a bit cheesy but I still like it.

13261880.review: I like Chuzzle Delexe, it fun and keeps you going for a while. I wish they would make more chuzzle games

12841872.review:
I can remember years ago when I was smaller my Mother loved this game. I recently searched up on Steam as to whether it offers this little bundle of joy. And well, it did.

A classic drag-and-match puzzle game. There are many out there like this. But I would have to say that this one is the grandmother of them all, as far as I'm concerned. The little cute, fuzzy, multi-coloured alien-ey things just help add to the appeal. The sound effects are incredibly adorable as well. You can easily spend around an hour completing classic mode on the hardest difficulty - possibly more. So, don't try and play for a quick 5 minutes or so. It's a trap; don't do it!

There are a pretty decent amout of achievements available in game - which will make a fun time trying to get them all. I, myself don't have all of them yet. However, it could prove quite frustrating trying to get them all. One of them is to complete a whole game without ONE wrong move. Surely, that's next to impossible, unless you strategically plan your moves beforehand. Which just adds to the beauty of this game. 

It is extremely challenging at times, which is what we all look for in a puzzle game. Why else would we want the puzzle genre?

Overall, cute graphics, amazing sound effects, challenging gameplay with around 4 or so different modes and achievements to get that fire in your heart going just that bit more. I would definitely recommend this game to absolutely anyone; regardless of age. Fun for the whole family!

10192436.review: This is a pretty fun game to play, with cute graphics and music.  It's a match-three game where you slide pieces in rows and columns rather then swap two.  There are chains that keep you from sliding that row-column, and 4x4 pieces that move both columns/rows they're in, as well as being unable to cross the boarders.  It's a good game and a good price, I recommend it.  Eight stolen cheese wheels out of ten.

So I could simply leave it at simply exploding balls of fuzz and let you draw your conclusions from that but I wont.

This is a great sit back and don't think game in the zen mode. You just play a never ending stream of exploding fur balls while listening to a slightly annoying yet relaxing song. 

The puzzle mode can be quite challenging at times to nearly impossible if you don't take careful consideration as to your moves. 

More of a casual gamers game but sometimes it's nice even for the hardcore gamer to sit back and relax to a great puzzle game like this one.

710890.review:
Chuzzle's a great, happy-themed, cutesy puzzle game similar to Bejeweled. The main star of the game is chuzzles: cute, spherical, fuzzy creatures that remind me an awful lot of tribbles from Star Trek.

Main selling point: this game is a good (and cheap) digital anti-depressant.

2519800.review: Mindless fun - perfect for when you just want to relax !!!!

378581.review:
All Pop Cap's games are just perfect. Easy to learn, "plug & play" but, with increasing difficulty and clear instructions before every new thing to learn. Intense rythm, you are always clicking the mouse, no time to rest. Original, they can be based on anything else but they do their own way and with outstanding imagination. The right difficulty at the right time, to maintain the interest. Variated play modes. Ridiculous simple controls, usually just the mouse and their two buttons, some times the arrows pad is also neeced but, that's all. Very good music and sound effects....
Well, if you already played Zuma, you know what I mean but, they have other interesting titles and this is one of them.
Highly recommeded for casual tmes, when you are in a hurry and want to play just a bit or, for that "in between big games" time.

2722807.review: This is a game were you get 3 or more Chuzzles in a line and kill them. The furry little guys are fun to look at and sometimes feel like that have personality. There are different sizes and types of Chuzzles to find and choose from. The game is really cleaver and kins of feels like a Bejeweled wanna be but different in the art and characters that you look at. This is a great casual game that puts thinking and sometimes quick thinking to the test. If you have good eyes to see a solution fast then this is the best game for you. This is a great office game when you have time to spare and burn. Ive really enjoyed playing it!
